# Cargo
The Supply department — commonly referred to as [color=cyan]Cargo[/color] — is responsible for keeping the station supplied with **raw materials**, **processed goods**, and **printed components**. Cargo works closely with Salvage to ensure the station always has the resources needed for construction, repairs, research, and everyday crew needs.
Unlike traditional stations, this facility does **not** use currency, bounties, or sales systems. Cargo’s value comes from **resource management**, **logistics**, and **material processing**.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Personnel
Cargo consists of: - [color=cyan]Cargo Technicians[/color] — logistics, storage, printing, processing - [color=cyan]Salvage Specialists[/color] — wreck recovery, material acquisition - Led by the [color=cyan]Quartermaster[/color] — department management & supply oversight
-------------------------------------------------------------
## What Cargo Does
Cargo has three core responsibilities:
### [color=cyan]1. Acquire Raw Materials[/color] Cargo gathers resources primarily by: - Using the **salvage magnet** to pull in wrecks - Recovering debris, scrap, and ore during salvage expeditions
### [color=cyan]2. Process Materials[/color] Once raw materials are collected, Cargo converts them into usable forms using: - The **material processor** - The **lathe** (for sheets, rods, parts, and components)
Cargo ensures the entire station has access to: - Metal & glass sheets - Plasteel - Electronics - Machine parts - Tools & structural materials
### [color=cyan]3. Print & Deliver Components[/color] Cargo prints parts and components requested by station departments. Cargo Technicians must: - Keep lathes stocked - Process ore quickly - Deliver printed items and materials - Maintain a healthy reserve of raw resources
The Quartermaster may prioritize essential requests during low supply periods.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Storage System
Cargo has access to a unique **high-capacity storage system**. This system allows the department to store: - Processed materials - Most raw ores - Common building supplies - Bulk components
Not everything can be stored, but **raw materials and basic components almost always can**.
The storage system enables Cargo to: - Stockpile large reserves - Retrieve stored goods during construction spikes - Ensure consistent material availability - Efficiently support engineering, science, and medical fabrication requests
-------------------------------------------------------------
## How to Operate Cargo Effectively
### Keep the Magnet Busy Regularly pull wrecks to keep supplies flowing. Communicate with Salvage on when to launch recovery.
### Process Immediately Ore sitting in a pile helps nobody. Convert it quickly into usable sheets or components.
### Maintain Stock Levels Ensure the station never runs out of: - Metal - Glass - Plastic - Electronics - Machine parts
### Respond to Crew Needs When someone needs something printed or supplied, Cargo should: - Check the storage system - Print required components - Deliver the items or make them available for pickup
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Cargo’s Purpose
Cargo’s mission is not profit — it is **support**.
Cargo ensures: - The station has the materials needed to function - Departments can construct, repair, and fabricate - Salvage can operate efficiently - Engineering always has structural materials - Science and Medical have access to printed components - Crew have the tools and parts needed for their tasks
A strong Cargo team enables the whole station to thrive.
